result.execSummary:
The defendant Jewel L Springfield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges. Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. Pay DNA surcharge. CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED TO ABOVE AND BALANCE TO BE RETURNED TO SURETY.

Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for medical/counseling release.  Defendant to report at NOON on 5-7-14. After serving SIX MONTHS the Court will allow counsel to file a motion to be considered to modify balance of sentence to be served on electronic monitoring. Credit for 61 days time served.

Concurrent with: with Case 13CF1386
Defendant is advised as a convicted felon she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor. Court advises defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jewel L Springfield

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: To and from Jewel Springfield received and filed.
for Cancellation of Huber Release Privileges signed and filed.

Huber/Work Release Modification Request
.
Request for Huber / Work Release Modification received from HOC and filed this date.  This case is assigned and forwarded to Judge Wagner, Br 38, for review. os
Bail Notice/Affidavit mailed to surety on 05/07/14. AR

Defendant Jewel L Springfield in court with attorney Allison M Ritter.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.   Additional statements by Mailani V., Lisa V-B., Mary C., and Oscar S.
The Court ordered the Defendant to serve ONE YEAR  in the House of Correction, concurrent with 13CF1386 with credit for 61 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for medical/counseling release.  Defendant to report at NOON on 5-7-2014.
After serving SIX MONTHS the Court will allow counsel to file a motion to be considered to modify balance of sentence to be served on electronic monitoring.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Pay DNA surcharge.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT TO BE APPLIED TO ABOVE AND BALANCE TO BE RETURNED TO SURETY.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon she may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is advised of her appeal rights by defense counsel.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed.
Ineligible voting acknowledgement filed.

Defendant Jewel L Springfield in court with attorney Allison M Ritter.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
IN CHAMBERS DISCUSSION HELD.  Case called.
Defendant does not wish to resolve matters with state's offer.
State places offer on record and then revokes it.
Court will pass cases so that parties may continue negotiations.
Case recalled.   State's offer is reinstated.  Defendant now wishes to resolve matters.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Case is adjourned to 5-5-2014 at 8:15 for sentencing.
Return of bail to be addressed after sentencing.

Defendant Jewel L Springfield in court with attorney Allison M Ritter.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State has made offer this morning.  Atty Ritter is requesting time to confer with defendant as to resolution.  Case is set for 5-1-2014 at 8:15 for final pretrial.

Defendant Jewel L Springfield in court.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Ritter contacted the court this morning and is ill.  Final pretrial is re-set to 4-29-2014 at 8:15am
Defendant is compliant with JusticePoint.

Justice Point, Nicole Pritzlaff, contacts the Court to advise that the defendant appeared today for random drug screen and tested positive for Oxycodone.  Ms. Springfield does have valid prescription for the medication.  Court will address on next date of 4-22-2014 if required.

Defendant Jewel L Springfield in court with attorney Allison Marie Ritter.  Erin M. Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel has been retained but has not received all discovery from prior counsel and is requesting an adjournment of the trial that is set for 3-10-2014.
The Court will set a new trial date and admonishes the defendant that this is the last lawyer (4 prior).
Outstanding motions will be heard on the final pretrial date of 4-22-2014.  Jury trial is set for 5-5-2014.
Return of property hearing will be heard on 4-22-2014.(13CF1386)

JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
As stated in the report, on 8-12-2013 the Court granted one half hour per week to pick up medications, there is no change being ordered as to this condition.

Defendant Jewel L Springfield in court.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Alsion Ritter appears as a friend of the court.  Defendant does not have the funds available to retain counsel unless the bail is modified to release some of the funds or a bail assignment is done.  The Court will not modify the bail.
Court will not adjourn the trial date of 3-10-2014 as defendant has had 3 prior attorneys and either will hire her own counsel or may represent herself.
Court passes cases.
Cases recalled.  Defendant advises that she will be obtaining the funds from her brother to retain counsel (Atty Ritter).  Cases are adjourned to 3-3-2014 at 8:15am. for final pretrial

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Atty Kulkoski moves to withdraw as counsel as defendant no longer qualifies for SPD representation.
Defendant has contacted Atty Alison Ritter as to all her cases and Atty Ritter is available for the next date of 2-27-2014.  Atty Kulkoski is allowed to withdraw.

Defendant Jewel L Springfield in court with attorney Glen B Kulkoski.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.
Motion to Withdraw as Counsel filed by Atty Kulkoski.

14RM004432  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
2/3/14 vf
Bail motion by the state argued and granted by the Court.  Bail set at $3,500 cash.  All other conditions of bail remain the same.

Defendant Jewel L Springfield in court with attorney Glen B Kulkoski.  Erin M Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee County Sheriff's Detective Todd Armstrong.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Due to lower-case pending, Defendant is advised this case is reassigned to Judge Wagner Branch 38.  Court ordered case adjourned for Arraignment and Scheduling Conference in Branch 38.  Arraignment scheduled for 02-20-2014 at 08:15 am.

14RM003365  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
1/24/14 vf
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for STANDARD SUPERVISION with DRUG TESTING.

Defendant Jewel L Springfield in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Jewel L Springfield in custody.  Kevin Shomin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Motion to dismiss by defense argued and DENIED by the Court.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DUGAN, Branch 10.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
